Package Trees

Interface Tree<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractTree, RedBlackTree
public interface Tree<T>
An interface that any BST should follow

  • Method Details

    • contains

      boolean contains(T obj)
      Search the tree for the specified key
      Parameters:
      obj - the key to be searched
      Returns:
      a boolean value that is true if the key is found and false otherwise

    • search

      AbstractNode<T> search(T obj)
      Search the tree for the specified key
      Parameters:
      obj - the key to be searched
      Returns:
      the node containing the key if found and null otherwise

    • insert

      void insert(T obj) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Inserts a node holding the value of the key to the tree
      Parameters:
      obj - the value to be inserted
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key is already in the tree

    • delete

      void delete(T obj) throws NoSuchElementException
      Removes the node that holds the specified value
      Parameters:
      obj - the value to be removed
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the key is not found in the tree

      void clear()
      Removes all nodes from the tree

      Prints an in-order traversal of the tree starting from its root

      Returns the number of nodes in the tree
      Returns:
      the size of the tree

    • getMax

      T getMax()
      Traverses the tree and returns the maximum value it holds
      Returns:
      the value of the maximum key in the tree

      Traverses the tree and returns the minimum value it holds
      Returns:

      Returns the root of the tree
      Returns:
      root of the tree

      Check if the tree is empty or not
